title: Disco Typeface ?
content: Anyone aware of a good classic-disco-rollerskating typeface?
author: torr duer

comments.content:
I would start with the [Chalet collection](http://web.archive.org/web/20111221030658/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/collections/chalet) and the [HouseGothic collection](http://web.archive.org/web/20111221030658/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/housegothic23t) along with a few others including [Powerhouse](http://web.archive.org/web/20111221030658/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/streetvanfonts) from House Industries.

As far as finding free ones, have fun finding then on your own at [www.dafont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20111221030658/http:/www.dafont.com/ "www.dafont.com").

[Larabie](http://web.archive.org/web/20111221030658/http:/new.myfonts.com/foundry/Larabie/fonts/) has a number of free fonts that look like they could be from the 70s.

- Lex

Doesnâ€™t get any better than Fontalicious:  
 [http://www.fontalicious.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20111221030658/http:/www.fontalicious.com/ "http://www.fontalicious.com/")

Try these free and fabulous inlines...

[http://www2.wind.ne.jp/maniackers/millennium.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20111221030658/http:/www2.wind.ne.jp/maniackers/millennium.html "http://www2.wind.ne.jp/maniackers/millennium.html")

[http://www.fenotype.com/font/fontpage.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20111221030658/http:/www.fenotype.com/font/fontpage.htm "http://www.fenotype.com/font/fontpage.htm")
